text:
51 yo M admitted to [**Hospital1 **] for altered MS(his sister found him earlier
   on [**2-14**] lethargic and she brought him to ED)He had a CT which showed
   SAH.He was transfered to [**Hospital1 **].In ED he was intubated for altered MS.Pt in
   DIC and CT of head and torso showed stable SAh and multiple septic
   emboli and infarcts to kidneys and spleen.In sepsis with lactate of 14
   at OSH down to 9.6 here.Pt transferred to MICU for further management.
   Subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH)
   Assessment:
   Pt with SAH.Rd the pt from ED sedated on propofol.CT in ED with stable
   bleed with not change from the one done from the OSH.
   Action:
   Neurosurg following.Q 1hr neuro obs stable.Remains sedated on propofol
   for pt comfort.
   Response:
   Neuro exam unchanged.Pt localizes to nailbed stimuli.PEARL size 2.
   Plan:
   Cont Q 1hr neuro checks.CT head in am.Keep INR <1.4 and plts >50 as per
   neurosurgery recs.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Pt was intubated in ED for acute MS changes.Rd the pt on AC 50%/PEEP
   5/TV 530/RR 16.Pt overbreathing on the vent.LS clear.
   Action:
   Serial ABG.Weaned O2 to 40%.
   Response:
   Bld gases good.Sating 99-100%.
   Plan:
   Wean in am.Cont AC for now.
   Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC)
   Assessment:
   Pt in DIC as from lab reports  at OSH with plts 7, INR 1.9, and
   petachaie. DIC most likely from malignancy and sepsis.
   Action:
   Pt was given 2 units FFP and 2 units Plts.Got additional 2 units FFP
   and 1 unit plts in ICU.
   Response:
   Plt count improving.INR.
   Plan:
   Sepsis, Severe (with organ dysfunction)
   Assessment:
   Pt with temp 104 inED and lactate 9.6.Met sepsis criteria.Pt in NSR
   with stable BP.Rd 5 lit FB in ED,
   Action:
   Pan cultured from ED, IV Abx cefepime/gentamycin/vanc now. Pt rd
   additional IV Flagyl in ED.Trending lactate.
   Response:
   Lactate improving.
   Plan:
